column4: Hey guys, if I'm using Ubuntu right now and I want to make my system boot from a windows disk, how do I do that?
you have a separate partition containing your Windows installation?
You want to reboot the computer and log onto Vista?
When I reboot, I'd like the system to boot from the DVD instead so that I can install it
does it currently boot straight into Ubuntu?
Change your BIOS settings to boot from the DVD drive
when you reboot your computer, you can typically go into the BIOS settings by pressing F2
your computer should briefly display a message like "Press F2 to enter BIOS" on bootup
you should do it quickly before it boots into Ubuntu
Alright, sounds good! Time to re-find my Vista :P
were you able to get into the BIOS settings?
how did you install Ubuntu anyhow?
Downloaded the karmic image from the main site and installed
